summary: This document is a chain of emails from the U.S. Attorney's Office (Southern District of New York) regarding travel approval requests for the Epstein investigation (2018R01618). It details planning for an international trip to Stockholm, Sweden, for an interview in late January/early February 2020, and references several prior domestic trips for victim interviews in Los Angeles and West Palm Beach.

persons.name: Alleyne
persons.context: Appears as a recipient (Cc) on travel approval request emails, likely involved in administrative or logistical support for the investigation team.

events.title: Planned Interview in Stockholm
events.description: The investigation team requests travel approval for an interview near Stockholm, Sweden, scheduled for January 29th and/or 30th, 2020.

events.title: Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: Prior travel request for an interview (or interviews) in Los Angeles on December 16 and/or 17, 2019.

events.title: Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: Prior travel request for an interview in Los Angeles on November 14, 2019.

events.title: Interview in West Palm Beach
events.description: Prior travel request for an interview in West Palm Beach on November 4, 2019.

events.title: Victim Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: Prior travel request for a victim interview in Los Angeles, tentatively flying Wednesday and returning by Friday.

events.title: Meetings and Interviews in West Palm Beach
events.description: Prior travel request for approximately three days for meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach, Florida.

events.title: Meetings and Interviews in West Palm Beach
events.description: Prior travel request for approximately three days for meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach, Florida.

events.title: Meetings and Interviews in Florida
events.description: Initial travel request for two days of meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach and/or Fort Lauderdale, Florida.

keyFacts: The document is part of the Epstein investigation case 2018R01618, described as 'an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity'.
It shows the U.S. Attorney's Office (Southern District of New York) was actively conducting international investigative travel to Stockholm, Sweden, for an interview as late as January/February 2020.
The emails reference multiple prior domestic trips for victim interviews in Los Angeles and West Palm Beach throughout 2019, indicating an ongoing, active investigation.
Travel planning details include specific flight itineraries, hotel options (Sheraton Stockholm Hotel, Hotel Kung Carl), and the need for conference rooms for interviews.
Most email addresses and sender/recipient names are redacted or partially obscured, but the correspondence is clearly between federal prosecutors and administrative staff.
